main event: A civilian observed a flat, silver dollar-shaped, brilliant shining object with slight flickering for about 20 minutes on August 25, 1961 in Brooklyn, New York.
interesting points: The object appeared to have a trail or streamer behind it and was drifting southwest at 25-30 knots.
The witness was initially watching a partial eclipse of the moon when the object was sighted.
New York International Airport had released a balloon within an hour of the sighting, which may have been what the witness observed.
The weather conditions at the time included a clear sky, light winds, and a weak inversion layer at 15,333 feet.
No other sightings of the object were reported.
result: Likely a weather balloon released from the nearby airport, though the object's appearance and movement were initially unexplained.
sighted object: A flat, silver dollar-shaped, brilliant shining object with slight flickering
witnesses: A civilian, female manager of a restaurant
photographs: No photographs included in the report
